item.title: Ceremonial Weapon Locations (Stained-Glass Window Puzzle) In Baldur's Gate 3
item.description:
As players explore the Rosymorn Monastery in Baldur's Gate 3 , they may encounter a puzzle that centers around a large stained-glass window that is surrounded by four pedestals. To solve this puzzle, fans must locate two ceremonial weapons and place them (and a non-ceremonial weapon) atop the aforementioned plinths. This guide is here to assist with that endeavor, and players can find the locations of all the Rosymorn Monastery ceremonial weapons in Baldur's Gate 3 detailed below.

Updated on December 31, 2025, by Nahda Nabiilah : While you can use the Ceremonial Weapons to complete the Dawnmaster puzzle, it's actually not necessary. That's because players can use any weapons as long as they are a battleaxe, mace, longsword, and warhammer. These normal weapons are acquired naturally while exploring the vast world of Baldur's Gate 3.

Rosymorn Monastery Ceremonial Weapon Locations In Baldur's Gate 3

The Dawnmaster Puzzle is found in the Rosymorn Monastery on the top floor. Players will inspect a stained-glass window featuring four masters to discover the solution to the puzzle. Each master is holding a weapon, and Tav must place the correct one on each altar to complete the puzzle.

Alternatively, simply approach the wall and lockpick it to immediately get the Dawnmaster's Crest. Keep in mind that you need to pass a DC 10 Perception check to see the stone wall and a DC 30 Sleight of Hand check to open it.

Completing the puzzle in BG3 grants the Morninglord's Radiance buff until Long Rest. This buff allows players to deal additional 1d4 Radiant damage.

Ceremonial Longsword

The Ceremonial Longsword is already on Dawmaster Welkinglory's pedestal at (X:70 Y:77). If players are interested in the Ceremonial Longsword, they can take it and put any other longsword in its place.

Ceremonial Battleaxe

Baldur's Gate 3 players can earn the Ceremonial Battleaxe by defeating the Guardian of Faith , a Level 7 NPC that is found beyond the Enchanted Door at (X:92 Y:45). Fans can bypass that door with a lockpick and then clear the furniture barricade with standard attacks. You can also destroy the wall on the other side and shoot the Guardian of Faith to death without approaching it. Similar to the longsword, any battleaxe will do just fine.

Ceremonial Warhammer

The Ceremonial Warhammer can be found in an eagle's nest at (X:82 Y:39), which can be accessed by climbing the Knotted Roots that are across from the aforementioned Enchanted Door. Here are several ways to collect this ceremonial weapon without killing the eagles:

  • Distract the eagles with a Bard's song, Minor Illusion, or another similar effect, and then steal the weapon.
  • Use an Invisibility Potion, grab the ceremonial weapon, and then escape with a spell like Misty Step.
  • Use Mage Hand to move the weapon while the party remains at a safe distance.

If the eagles are too much for you, especially in honour mode, Tav can use other warhammers on the altar.

Mace

While not a ceremonial weapon, players will need a mace to solve the stained-glass window puzzle. While any mace seems to do the job, there is a Rusty Mace nearby that players can definitely use, and here are details on how to get that Baldur's Gate 3 weapon:

  • Head south past the Enchanted Door , where the Ceremonial Battleaxe was found.
  • Pass through the door on the left , and jump down the broken staircase that is beyond.
  • At the bottom of the stairs, break through the barricade in the northwest corner of the room (X:97 Y:46).
  • Go left after the barricade.
  • The Rusty Mace is on the ground at (X:85 Y:32).

Another Rusty Mace can be acquired from the Dawnmaster's grave. From the Guardian of Faith's location, head down the stairs and jump to the ground to the left. Climb the small hill and dig up the grave to find a coffin (X:127 Y:-8). Inside is a rusty mace as well as a letter revealing that this is the grave of the original Dawnmaster, who was buried with his Ceremonial Mace.

The Ceremonial Mace that was stolen from the coffin can be looted from a Kobold Looter in the Firewine storage room (X: 45 Y: 37). But the rusty mace or any other mace will get the job done if players don't feel like going around the area or fighting enemies .

What to Do with Ceremonial Weapons In Baldur's Gate 3

With the weapons in hand, players are ready to solve the associated puzzle. To do this, fans should make their way to the stained-glass window in the room at (X:74 Y:68) and perform these actions:

  • Throw the Ceremonial Battleaxe on top of Dawnmaster Vaseid's pedestal at X:74 Y:69.
  • Throw the Ceremonial Warhammer on top Dawnmaster Seed's pedestal at X:77 Y:75.
  • Throw the mace on top of Dawnmaster Stockhold's pedestal at X:75 Y:71.

Upon placing the final weapon, an opening will appear in the wall at X:74 Y:75, revealing a pouch. Inside this pouch, fans will find a note to the next Dawnmaster as well as the Dawnmaster's Crest. For those players who are curious, this item can be used during the acquisition of Baldur's Gate 3 's Blood of Lathander, though it is possible to obtain that legendary mace without ever collecting the crest.

How To Reach The Blood Of Lathander In Baldur's Gate 3

To reach the The Blood of Lathander , enter the Cr√®che and try to persuade the guards to let you pass, or use Lae'zel to handle the situation. Proceed forward and turn right to find a waypoint.

Head left towards the door to see Kith'rak Therezzyn and Ch'r'ai W'wargaz arguing. After the short cutscene, either persuade Kith'rak Therezzyn to hand over the Gith Shard or pickpot her. You can also fight her to get the item. Place the shard on the Githyanki Barrier Disruptor to remove the barrier.

Proceed forward to arrive at a room full of Githyanki with Ch'r'ai W'wargaz standing in the middle. Ignore him if you wish and go to the room on the left. Turn the statues in the correct direction to reveal a path.

Inside, players must destroy the crystals to remove the barriers to eventually arrive at the final room, where the The Blood of Lathander is located.

Insert the Dawnmaster Crest to safely obtain the legendary weapon.

item.title: Skyrim Player Takes a 1 Year Break and Comes Back to an Adorable Surprise
item.description:
A Skyrim player booted up the game for the first time in a year only to discover an adorable surprise waiting for them. While it's not uncommon for Skyrim players to come back to the game with little memory of what their character was doing when they last played, this particular surprise involved a forgotten mod.

Skyrim is arguably one of the most modded games around, with the game having mods for everything from upgrading textures to making it more like a Pokemon game than Skyrim . While Skyrim is perfectly enjoyable without a single mod, given that it's now 14 years old, plenty of gamers use them, with popular mod hub NexusMods displaying over 100,000 mods for the Special Edition of Skyrim alone.

Maxwell the Cat Welcomes Player Home to Skyrim

On Reddit, user Havry97 shared a post explaining that they just begun a new run in Skyrim after not having touched the game in a year. Though it was a new run, their mods were still enabled, and they had forgotten about one in particular that adds Maxwell the Cat to the game. A gameplay clip shows the player exploring Jorrvaskr in Whiterun when a cheerful tune starts faintly playing in the background. As the player approaches the sound, they walk into a room with a Stone of Barenziah, but the stone has been replaced by a miniature Maxwell that spins in place.

Other Skyrim fans have been amused to see the Maxwell mod, and many wanted to get it for themselves. The OP shared that they used Maxwell The Cat - Stone of Barenziah Replacer, which can be found on NexusMods. Other players pointed out that as silly as the mod is, it could even serve a purpose, as the tune playing helps players to discover that there's a stone nearby and seek it out. Given that the stones are fairly small and that players need to collect 24 of them in order to complete the No Stone Unturned quest and rebuild the Crown of Barenziah, Maxwell could actually be quite helpful. To make it even better, with this mod, the Crown of Barenziah that's placed on display in the Thieves Guild also gets its own spinning Maxwell on top.

Maxwell the Cat and Spinning Cat Skyrim Mods

Maxwell the Cat, outside of this Skyrim mod, was a meme that took off in 2022. Like most memes, it's undergone some evolution over time, but it started out as a photo of a tuxedo cat that was converted into a Garry's Mod 3D model. From there, it gained popularity, became a carryable item in the game, and eventually a clip was produced of the model spinning in a circle, to which another person overlaid the song on top. At that point, Maxwell the Cat reached peak virality, with the Skyrim mod being uploaded about a year later.

In fact, another modder also added Maxwell the Cat to Skyrim as an item that players can find and carry with them. Maxwell isn't even the only spinning cat meme to be featured in a Skyrim mod, though, as the OIIA OIIA spinning cat has its own mod that not only puts it in the game, but turns it into a full-fledged follower for the player. However, it might be best to not install the two together if the goal is to find the Stones of Barenziah, as the OIIA OIIA cat plays its song wherever it goes, and it would probably drown out Maxwell.

item.title: ARC Raiders: Unexpected Initiative Quest (Fertilizer & Water Pump Locations)
item.description:
The Unexpected Initiative is a quest in ARC Raiders given by Tian Wen, who asks players to help them restart a greenhouse project to improve food production. The job is to recover two specific items from the Buried City: fertilizer from the Grandioso Apartments and a Water Pump from the broken rooftop gardens at Piazza Roma. While it may look like a simple fetch quest, players will need to locate the items themselves in two PvP hot zones on Buried City.

Players can collect both items in any order. Simply head to the location closest to your spawn point. Just make sure to pick up both items in one round to avoid bugging out the mission.

Fertilizer Location on Grandioso Apartments Rooftop in ARC Raiders (Unexpected Initiative)

To get the Fertilizer for the Unexpected Initiative quest in ARC Raiders , players will need to reach the Grandioso Apartments and enter through the lobby . The apartments can be found on the eastern portion of the map, and is highlighted as a medium-value loot area, so expect some Raider activity.

Looking for more in the Buried City region? Check out our ARC Raiders Buried City interactive map!

After entering, locate an empty elevator shaft with a zipline and take it to the second-last floor. Once you reach here, keep a lookout for Pops and Fireballs, as they'll try to hone in on your location.

Simply turn right after exiting the zipline and take a flight of stairs to the rooftop. Right after entering the roof, players will find some pots in front of the doorway . Interact with them to get Fertilizer to complete the first objective of the Unexpected Initiative quest in ARC Raiders . Now exit the area, quietly, and head to the next location.

Water Pump Location on Piazza Roma Broken Rooftop Garden in ARC Raiders (Unexpected Initiative)

The next location on the list is the broken rooftop garden at Piazza Roma, which is a building just south of the Grandioso Apartments in ARC Raiders . The building does not have any map marker on it, so simply follow the location indicated in the image above to find the right building.

Enter the building in the Piazza Roma district and go up some flights of stairs to reach the rooftops. Since this area isn't marked as any loot zone, there's low chance you'll bump into any other raiders here.

After reaching the rooftop of the building, directly turn right, and you'll spot some bathtubs with fertilizer in them. Enter the archway of fertilizer beds to interact with the small machine at the end with tubes sticking out (marked above).

Once the interaction animation is complete, a Water Pump will drop from the machine that you can pick up to complete the second objective of the Unexpected Initiative quest in ARC Raiders . Now, simply head for a nearby metro station to safely extract from the Buried City.

Try Night Raid to Complete the Unexpected Initiative Quest (Optional)

You can easily complete the Unexpected Initiative quest normally, but it's recommended to do it in a Night Raid . Since you'll be visiting high-value loot locations anyway, completing the quest during a Night Raid will increase your chances of getting rare blueprints, including for Tempest AR.

item.title: ARC Raiders: Lost in Transmission Quest Guide (Spaceport Control Tower Key)
item.description:
The Lost in Transmission quest in ARC Raiders has a simple objective: to use the terminal in Spaceport Control Tower A6 and establish a connection with Speranza. However, Control Tower A6 is a heavily contested area that's crawling with hostile raiders looking for a PvP fight. This will make the quest a bit tough to complete, but with the right approach, you'll complete Lost in Transmission in no time.

How to Reach the Top of Control Tower A6 in ARC Raiders (Lost in Transmission)

Once players accept the Lost in Transmission quest in ARC Raiders , they'll receive the Spaceport Control Tower key from Shani . This item will be vital in reaching the top of Control Tower A6 in Spaceport, which is located in the center of the map, just beside the Vehicle Maintenance and Container Storage buildings.

Before you deploy to the Spaceport map in ARC Raiders , make sure to keep the Spaceport Control Tower key in your inventory's Safe Pocket . Also, it'll be handy to keep a few smoke grenades with you in case you need to break off from enemy raider sight lines and escape a PvP confrontation. Now that you're all set, go ahead and enter the Spaceport map.

Once you spawn, head to the center of the Spaceport map, towards the Control Tower A6, and try to enter from the doorway right under the big A6 marker on the tower. After heading into the Control Tower, head through the first set of doorways to the left and follow the path to the right to come across a locked door.

Use the Spaceport Control Tower key to unlock the door, which leads to the zipline. Using the zipline will take you to the top of Control Tower A6 , where you'll find the terminals to progress through the Lost in Transmission quest in ARC Raiders .

Once you reach the top of Control Tower A6 in Spaceport, interact with the terminal to the left to complete the Lost in Transmission. Since you're already atop Control Tower A6, make sure to loot all the drawers and cabinets here, which have a high chance of granting players Epic rarity items.

How to Get Better Loot While Completing Lost in Transmission Quest

It's recommended to place the Spaceport Control Tower key in your safe pocket when you head out to the Night Raid. The risk of running into PvP players is higher during this map condition, but a higher risk will net you higher rewards.

As you may have experienced already, the rewards for completing ARC Raiders quests are pretty mediocre. Lost in Transmission is one of the best quests to get some high-value loot, only if you complete it during a major map condition like a Spaceport Night Raid .

After the Cold Snap update, the loot quality in key loot rooms has been significantly buffed . This means you can normally complete the mission and secure some of the best loot in the game. Players will also have a higher chance of acquiring some of the rarer blueprints from the Lost in Transmission quest.

Once you're done, simply extract safely out of Spaceport and talk to Shani back at Speranza. Players will receive a legendary Snap Hook (grappling hook) as a reward for completing the Lost in Transmission quest in ARC Raiders .

item.title: A New 3D Platformer Just Hit Steam and You Can Play It for Free
item.description:
A new 3D platformer on Steam called Skybound has received promising reviews from fans of the genre, and the good news is that it's completely free. While there are plenty of free-to-play platformers on Steam, Skybound is especially worth checking out, as it combines the relaxing vibe of cozy games with the fast-paced action of precision platformers.

The final days of 2025 were a treat for fans of freebies, as Steam publishers offered several interesting titles for free. Some of the free-to-keep games available in December included Undercroft Warriors , Caveman World: Mountains of Unga Boonga , Rat Quest , and The Deed: Dynasty . However, those limited-time promotions have ended, and fans will have to wait until 2026 for more giveaways on Valve‚Äôs storefront. Meanwhile, the list of free-to-play games on Steam continues to grow, offering plenty of fun options like Skybound .

Skybound Is Free-to-Play on Steam

Developed by a team of students under the name Half Home Games, Skybound launched on Steam in late December. The game is completely free to play for all users, with no strings attached, though it currently includes only Act 1 of the campaign. Half Home Games has confirmed that more acts could be added in the future if the game is well received, which is great news for fans. Skybound 's core gameplay centers on navigating a 3D floating world using grappling hooks while solving environmental puzzles along the way. Despite featuring three unique explorable islands, Skybound is a relatively short Steam game, making it an ideal choice for fans of speedrunning.

Skybound Gameplay Features at a Glance

  • Parkour
  • Free exploration
  • Grappling hook
  • Three unique floating islands
  • Voice actors
  • 3D graphics
  • Environmental puzzles
  • Destructible objects
  • Hidden collectibles
  • Speedrun-friendly missions
  • Choice-based campaign

The story of Skybound follows Bell, a young archaeologist in a fictional universe. One day, she is tasked with retrieving ancient artifacts that could help uncover mysteries about the past. As Bell searches for these artifacts across the floating islands, she begins to notice that some things don't add up, prompting her to investigate the islands more closely.

Skybound Has a Heartwarming Development Story

What makes the development process unique is that each student came from a different university.

According to Half Home Games, Skybound was created by a group of students at the Danish Academy of Digital, Interactive Entertainment. What makes the development process unique is that each student came from a different university, turning the project into a collaborative showcase of emerging talent. Given the project's scale and time constraints, Half Home Games also notes that Skybound may contain some bugs and glitches, and thanks players for their patience and understanding.

Fans of 3D Platformer Games Seem to Love Skybound

A quick look at Skybound 's Steam page shows very promising user reviews, with 95% of players recommending the game at the time of writing. The number of reviews is still limited, so it will be interesting to see how the overall score evolves as more players try it. For now, those who have played the game highlight three main aspects: they praise the beautiful visuals reminiscent of some of Steam‚Äôs best cozy games, enjoy the fast-paced, free movement mechanics that make exploration fun, and appreciate that, despite being free, Skybound features a few well-performing voice actors.

Skybound Isn't the Only Free-to-Play Student Project on Steam

Fans of the genre may also want to check out another free 3D platformer on Steam called Palette Cleaners . Like Skybound, Palette Cleaners was developed by a group of dedicated students and has received very positive reviews. Another great option for gamers looking to support young developers is Dillo's Dilemma . This student project has attracted hundreds of 3D platformer enthusiasts and is also completely free to play.
